parameters: Jacob drew steel, the sound echoing through the tavern
and drawing every pair of eyes. Zane's face went stony
for a moment, but then avalanched into laughter and
mirth. "You'd kill me, then, monk?" spat Zane.
"You must have forgotten your own book. 'Thou shalt not
kill.' I'm not afraid of your threats." The drunken
brawler suddenly pulled two long knives from his belt,
"I'm going to kill you now and take that book from you.
Ought to be worth something to somebody." Zane leaped
forward, and Jacob's sword flashed in the torchlight.
A split second later, Zane's blades clanged against the
far walls. But Jacob did not stop at disarming his
opponent--he was too deadly, too proud.
No, Jacob's weapon swung through the air, the razor tip
scraping Zane's neck, slitting it. The metal monk knelt
Quietly, he prayed over the man, begging his Lord to
forgive him his sins and wing this soul to heaven. When
he was done, he caught a last flicker of light in
He whispered: "If you had been more familiar with my
book, you might have known another verse: 'I come, not
to bring peace, but a sword.' I did not seek a fight
with you. But I am through running."
I'm sorry, sir. You don't appear to have

A thousand years ago, or so the story goes, an ancient
evil named \C[2]Bahamut\C[0] ruled the skies with fire and
The nations of \C[3]Spyria\C[0] banded together, but it was not
enough. Cities were razed and thousands slaughtered.

He joined forces with the humans and together they

locations have been lost to time.

your ears! And, uh.. listen with them!

name: Order in the court more silently

parameters: Many millenia ago the planet's life force itself manifested
among us. As does happen, a religion formed around it.
Those who communed with and watched over
\C[14]The Source\C[0], as it came to be known, were called
They built an empire around \C[14]The Source\C[0] to protect
it. They dwelled in what was known as the \C[6]Golden City\C[0].
For many years it was the center of \C[3]Spyria\C[0]. Great
temples of knowledge were housed there. Nations joined in
friendship there. And at the center of it all, \C[14]The
From time to time, \C[14]The Source\C[0] would invite specific
people to its temple. Some thought it found amusement in
conversing with the intellectuals and scholars that had spawned
We were such people. \C[14]The Source\C[0] sent an invitation
Wait. Do you mean to say that \C[2]Bahamut\C[0] was once a human
named \C[4]Micah\C[0]? And you were human too?
Yes. We were all friends back then. And together we travelled
to \C[6]The Golden City\C[0]. Unfortunately we had no idea what
so that it could walk amongst the life it had spawned. \C[4]Micah\C[0]
agreed, and \C[14]The Source\C[0] began to transfer a portion of
But the power proved too much for his mind. It drove him insane.
He drank deeper and deeper from the wellspring of \C[14]The Source\C[0] until
at last it cut him off. But the damage was done.
He transformed many of us, including myself, into demon half-breeds
bound to his servitude. As for himself, he took the form of a large,
red dragon. And that was the day \C[4]Micah\C[0] ceased to be. The
Many great writers sometimes find the desire to write under
an alias. Some people admire them for this, and long to live
Are you one such person? Did you name your character \C[4]Bubblecheeks\C[0]
or \C[4]Fartblaster\C[0], only to fall in love with this game
and regret your immature choice of names?
Would you like to use the \C[6]Ghostwriter's Quill\C[0] to
The quill fades to ash as it bends reality and the memories of
everyone in the world around it. You have always been and forever shall
The quill will be here if you change your mind.

If highest dice is 5 and total dice is 14 or MORE

If not raised, 40% chance to raise it

Called, so his bet equals the current bet amount.

subtract any that he's already bet (difference)
